title.narrative: Technical Assistance to National Employment Program (NEP) 2016-2018
Tekniskt stöd till National Employment Program (NEP) 2016-2018

description.narrative: Continuation of technical assistance to improve results based management and capacity of the National Employment Program (NEP)

Sverige ger finansiellt stöd till Rwandas nationella sysselsättningsprogram NEP samt finansierar tekniskt stöd till programmet. NEP koordineras av ett sekretariat som arbetar med att utveckla robusta uppföljningssystem för programmet. Denna stödjande insats, som beslutet avser, syftar till att fortsätta tillhandahålla tekniskt stöd till sekretariatet inom uppföljning och utvärdering för att säkerställa kvalitén i programmet. Ambassaden i Kigali har avropat tjänsten genom Sidas ramavtal inom programmets huvudsakliga ämnesområden, nämligen sysselsättning och marknadsutveckling.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This is a completion report for the separate contribution for technical assistance in M&E to the National Employment Programme (NEP). Sweden is funding Rwanda’s National Employment Programme (NEP) with 160 million SEK over five years, 2014 – 2019. The purpose of NEP is to address one of Rwanda’s main development challenges, namely to create sufficient productive employment opportunities. When NEP started in 2014, monitoring and evaluation was identified as one of the main weaknesses not the least in the review of internal management and control. Sweden therefore decided to have a separately funded M&E expert, working full-time at the NEP Secretariat with the purpose of assisting NEP to build an efficient M&E system as well as building capacity with the implementing institutions. During the mid-term evaluation of NEP (Dec 2016-Feb 2017) it was concluded that even though NEP had over the first two and half programme years improved considerably as regards reporting of results considering where it started from both in terms of data collection, analysing and reporting formats, M&E of NEP needed further improvements. The technical assistance from the M&E expert had contributed to concrete results in terms of improved results framework being developed, a data collection system involving all the 30 Districts was in place and streamlined, the overall quality of the quarterly progress reports had improved significantly. In addition, the NEP Secretariat had adopted a more proactive role including conducting a tracer study to measure the development impact as well as specific field visits to follow-up on results. The M&E expert, funded by the Embassy, was very involved in the above improvements and assessed to be instrumental in further strengthening and capacity building of the implementing institutions. As a response to the above conclusions in the mid-term evaluation, the NEP Secretariat developed a very ambitious M&E plan.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
